intro: Basiphyllaea corallicola, commonly known as the coral-like leaf plant, is a unique species belonging to the family Restionaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves that resemble coral structures, giving it its common name. Native to South Africa, this plant thrives in coastal and sandy environments. It has a compact growth habit with dense, wiry foliage that often forms a low-growing mat. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
